xs:annotation.xs:documentation: API response for Location Engine Attributes
Response for Address Attributes
Most of world address validation.
The address as cleaned (validated) by the geocode engine.
The relative position of a coordinate along the matched street segment. Ex: 50
For USA = county

There are five Administrative Area Boundaries layers (1, 2, 3, 4, 5). These layers contain the boundaries that divide countries into administrative areas such as country, state, county, city, or settlement. These designations vary on a country by country basis. (In the US for example, the Administrative Area Boundary 3 layer displays the county boundaries, and Administrative Area Boundary 4 displays the City boundaries.). At moment we only return 2,3,4,5.

Newer version of the Administrative Area Boundaries layers, Country has its own field in the newer dataset thus no equivalent to old version layer 1. new 1 = old 2, new 2 = old 3, new 8 = old 4, BuiltupArea = old 5 At moment we only return 1,2,8.

Names Places The Named Places layer contains the names of populated areas within a NAVSTREETS coverage area (e.g. all US cities, towns, or villages). In Europe, there are named places for all municipalities, and all other settlements that are over 200,000m2(meters squared). The location of a named place is usually a city centre, or a main point such as a city hall, police station, or library. The Named Places layer is especially useful for calculating routes to a non-specific location (e.g. London to Paris).
ex: ArcGISOnlineGeocoder, AEGIS_MOW

A code used by one vendor to describe the match level: point address, street address interpolation, postal code of a geocode. All codes with a leading ?A? are typically acceptable as street level and above matches. Ex: ASO
A code used to describe any adjustments ?standardizations?, address string issues used by one vendor?s engine. For example the lack of a street direction indicator. Ex: S91
A score presented from one vendor?s engine if that engine is used. The range is 0-100. Typically 70 is the minimum score used as an indicator of a valid street match. Ex: 90

A 3 digit number ranging from 100-999 that represents a standardization of match level across geocode engines. The higher the score the better the placement. A score of 700-799 would mean a street level match. Ex: 700
Ex: ENGLISH, FRENCH
Ex: street-city-region-postal-postalext
Ex: house-num prefix-type prefix-dir street-name suffix-type suffix-dir
Ex: 288 RUE RADISSON MONT-ST-HILLAIR3 QC J3H 2Z4
Container to store the ESP Catalog response attributes
coverage laryer contain all the GIS info
MSAG e911 address validation.
MSAG: Master Street Address Guide record in ranged format.
Examples: HCRT; DMHD; PT01
Ex: CUYA
The tax area code (TAR) or the code for the tax structure levied on customers in the geographic segment.
The E911 provider of the MSAG address. Examples: NC - Intrado Direct 1; WY - CenturyLink; TX - North Central Texas Counties (NCTCO)
SAG service address validation.
SAG: Street Address Guide record in ranged format.
Represents a structure that is a List of similar Descriptive addresses.
Descriptive Address name. The descriptive is a reference to a specific address location. Ex: WOODLAWN LAKE APTS
PREFIX portion of the BASIC_HOUSE_NUMBER. Currently this is populated for GRID HOUSE NUMBERS in WI at this time. Ex: S63
The "number" part of the basic street address. Ex: 2600
The Telco assigned house number for an unnumbered address location. Ex: 191
The basic house number suffix portion of the house number. Telco assigned house number suffixes are stored here. Ex: 1/2, A
A directional (e.g. E, W, N, S, SE, NW, etc.) that precedes the street name. This field is for a primay address. Ex: N
The basic address thoroughfare the descriptive name is associated to. Ex: DR
The post directional suffix of the street address. This field is for the primary address. (i.e. address is N MAIN ST NW, then NW is the post directional suffix). Ex: NW
The basic address street name the descriptive name is associated to. Ex: MAIN
The community name from the SAG. This may be abbreviated. Ex: JEFFERSON COUNTY
State code of the address. Ex: CA
The 5-digit ZIP code from the SAG. Ex: 94583
The descriptive Remark (RMK) for this particular descriptive address. Ex: FOREST WOODS (105-137,O) -- HOUSE NO and FOREST PKWY PLUS APT NO
Will indicate if address returned is fielded, sag-ranged, or a descriptive alternate.
Fiber To The Business Multi Dwelling Unit. An indicator for supplemental addresses found.
Owned wiring indicator for PREMIS SW region (if customer owns the wiring).
OVALS/MLDB will derive WSOPI (working service on premise indicator) and set to Y if there is working service (at least one working TN) at the location.
Alternate descriptive name for the location. Ex: EL CAMINO RANCH
SE Network facilities AREA Transfer cut live date.
Impacted NPA and NXX.
SE Network facilities Area Transfer number change date.
SE Network facilities AREA Transfer wire center clli.
Identifies if FBS certified.
The Building Clli code unique to each building
The 8 character Common Language Location Identifier code that indicates the wire center that serves this address. Ex: SNANTXFR
Driving Instructions to locate a location.
Remark set by ATT Fraud Team to provide information regarding possible fraud for a specific location. Ex: **FRAUD ALERT DATE 06/13/11?TN 984-1234/314 MANDATORY POSID PROCESS**

Match code indicating the precision of the latitude and longitude assignment. Ex: 0: Matched in address level. 1: Nine-digit match. Usually indicates precision to a particular block face. 4: Seven-digit match. Usually indicates precision within a few blocks. 5: Five-digit match. Usually indicates precision to within a mile or two. 7: No match in Centroid-Level. 8: No match in Address-Level. 9: No match in Centroid-Level or Address-Level.
Out of region operating company name. Ex: VERIZON
LFACS living unit ID.
Represents a structure that contians data attributes for the location standards of a location, if it exists. NOTE: If NTWK_QUAL_INDICATOR is set to Y or F, then this structure is NULL.
"The following are the valid FIDs for unit: APT, LOT, RM, SLIP, SUIT, or UNIT.

The following are the valid location standard patterns for the Southwest/West regions: ltr, #, ltr#, #ltr, ltr hyphen #, # hyphen ltr, ltr hyphen ltr, # hyphen #, ltr space #, # space ltr. The following are possible location standard patterns for the Southeast region: N-A, N A, NA, A-N, A N, AN, NA-A, A A.
"The following is the valid FID for elevation: FLR

The following are the valid location standard patterns for the Southwest/West regions: ltr, #, ltr#, #ltr, ltr hyphen #, # hyphen ltr, ltr hyphen ltr, # hyphen #, ltr space #, # space ltr.
The following are possible location standard patterns for the Southeast region: N-A, N A, NA, A-N, A N, AN, NA-A, A A
The following are the valid FIDs for structure: BLDG, WNG, PIER

The following are the valid location standard patterns for the Southwest/West regions: ltr, #, ltr#, #ltr, ltr hyphen #, # hyphen ltr, ltr hyphen ltr, # hyphen #, ltr space #, # space ltr The following are possible location standard patterns for the Southeast region: N-A, N A, NA, A-N, A N, AN, NA-A, A A.
The fault code if the address was USPS unassigned; the status code if the address was USPS assigned. Ex: S90000
Internally generated and supported unique key to identify a unique Location Record. This field is not used by external clients until June 2012. Ex: USD012ABCDEF

This is an Oracle array of varchar2. OVALS unique key to identify a LFACS/GRANITE service address. The N maximum number of nspInqIds in the array will be 5. NOTE: When NTWK_QUAL_INDICATOR is set to N, OVALS/MLDB will returm at most 1 nspInqIds . When NTWK_QUAL_INIDCATOR Iis set to Y, OVALS/MLDB will return the maximum number of nspInqIds that exist. Ex: P264084943
Primary descriptive name for location. Ex: CAMINO RANCH
Indicates if in region or in franchise. Y=in region in franchise, O=in region out of franchise, N=out of region out of franchise
RESTRICTION_RECORDS represents a structure that contians data attributes for the SE restriction if it exists
SE SERVICE -RESTRICTIONS establish service date.
SE SERVICE -RESTRICTIONS text code.
Remark set for a Basic Address (RMKB). NOTE: If NTWK_QUAL_INDICATOR is set to Y or F, then this field is NULL. Ex: **SMARTMOVES**
SE Service Instructions specific to a location. Ex: Have customer call 911 for house number.
Set to ?true? if rmkb contains ?SMARTMOVES?
SE Telcordia Message Code for a specific V and H location.
VH-vertical and horizontal is based on old methodology to geographically identify a location. It was created to calculate distance between two points.
X coordinate
Y coordinate
MW ASON E911 county services data.
MW ASON E911 county services data.
This is for descriptive addresses only. Indicates if the descriptive is for a range of basics or not. A range of basics is a group of locations.
The SAG Street Address type. P = Primary Street Name, A= Alternate Street Name.

This is derived for SE SAG ranges only. Is set to 1 when RANGE_TYPE_CD is N (numbered). Is set to '2' or '3' when RANGE-TYPE_CD is U (unnumbered) and populated as the same value populated in AHN_TYPE_CD (2 or 3).
Assigned House Number Type Code. Values=S, T, X for SW and W; 2, 3 for SE
A code identifying the Residence Service Center (RSC) serving the customers in the geographic segment. Ex: DBS-PROF
Concatenation of fields CENTRAL-OFFICE-1-2 and CENTRAL-OFFICE-3 on the ASON SAG Extract file. MW and W only. Ex: AB, 713
Indicates ATT or ILEC. Ex: GTE, B. clec=competitve local exchange carrier
SE cross boundary state. Ex: FL
The code for the directory or directories in which listings for the customers in the geographic segment will appear without charge. Ex: TUL
MW ASON E911 county services data. Ex: XH
MW ASON E911 county services data. Ex: CH
MW ASON E911 county services data. Ex: CH
The exchange code for the sag range record. Ex: KWD
EXCH_STR_CTY_RMK. EXCH_STR_CTY_RMK is a remark that provides further detailed information for the a street in a specific SAG community(city) and exchange. EXCH_STR_CTY_RMK is used in the East(CT).
Exchange (combination of exchange code and central office in the W). Ex: LA AN
Identifies FCC Wire Center Trial project.
Foreign Township Listing. Auto populated from the Exchange and Community. East region only. Ex: PLFD

The Geographic Segment Code associated with this Primary Address entry. This is used along with the Wire Center Code to relate the Primary Address entry to a Geographic Segment (region). This is used for W and SW only at this time. Ex: G307
SE Independent Company Indicator. The ones in AL, MS are for consolidated billing only. The ones in TN and NFL are for ALEC addresses or OOF.

Local Access and Transport Area Definition - A geographical area within which a divested Bell Operating Company (BOC) is permitted to offer exchange telecommunications and exchange access services. Returned for all regions. OVALS/MLDB will derive this from a LFACS WIRECENTER table internally. Ex: 720, 526
A code representing the Local Exchange Carrier responsible for addresses within this Geographic Segment. Ex: TM00
CLLI8 code from RSAG for SE only.
Used to identify one data item that is specific to a geographic segment. This column is also used to indicate that a community is split by SAG Areas or SAG Entities. Ex: G307 (P)
A 6 character code that indicates the Local Serving Office Code.
Overlay Number Plan Area codes (NPA) in which the geographic segment for the specific SAG range is contained. There can be up to 5 Overlay NPAs that are comma seperated. Ex: 858,760,714
Post Office (PO). Must be a valid post office for the Sag Community(city) and zipcode. PO is used in the East (CT). Ex: BRKLYN
The SAG Address range type. U = Unnumbered, N= Numbered.
Rate center for the location. Ex: MOJAVE
MW Rate zone Band. Ex: B
The code for the rate zone in which the geographic segment is located. Ex: TX1
The regional SAG data source that OVALS/MLDB received the SAG Range data from. Ex: SW, W, E

Sag level Remark for TN Lists (RMKT) or wirecenter. Data won't be present in this until PREMIS REPL. There can be up to 4 lines of RMKT. They are field position delimited by the following: Pos 1-80 is RMKT1, Pos 81-160 is RMKT2, Pos 161-240 RMKT3, Pos 241-320 is RMKT4. Ex: KIRKWOOD WIRE CENTER 214-748-9250
Internally generated and supported unique key to identify a unique SAG Range record. Ex: 77888
SAG area/boundary (aka SAGA). This is present in SW W and MW. Ex: SUBA
The number plan area code (NPA) in which the geographic segment for the specific SAG range is contained. Ex: 314
The REGIONAL SAG. Either CLLI8 code or... Ex: STLS, 421
Segment is used for any address range associated to a specific sequenced street, the Exchange/Full Street Name/Community/Sequence where Sequence is >= 1. Segment is used in the East(CT). Ex: A, B, C
When a street name, exchange, and sag community name/city do not form a unique key, then a sequence is provided to provide a unique key. Value must be 1 thru 9 or blank/space.
A code identifying the service area. Alpha version of the LATA. Applicable to CA and NV.
The tax area code (TAR) or the code for the tax structure levied on customers in the geographic segment. Ex: KWD, SAN
The telephone features or code for the features which can be offered to customers in the geographic segment. Ex: EAS
Terminating Traffic Area is a geographic zone where a specific group of telephone numbers has been allocated to subscribers for rate purposes. Ex: 821
SE Facilities Available Indicator. Indicates if network facilities are available or not.
CA Quick Dial Tone Indicator.
SE Quickserver Indicator.
Disconnect Reason associated with the TN. Ex: NP
Listed Name associated with the TN. Ex: ICABOB CRANE
Telephone Number status. i.e. indicates that the TN is working or non-working. N=Non-Working; P=Pending; SB=Sublet; SS=Suspend; U=Unknown; W=Working
Last activity date for the TN.
Circuit identifier. Ex: A3.HCGS.416055..SC CKL 3
Circuit Identifier status. i.e. indicates that the CKTID is working or non-working. Ex: N
Last activity date for the Circuit ID.
US landbase address validation.
Will indicate if the address returned is strictly from landbase or if from GLID database.
MatchCode starts with ?E?, set flag to ?No?, else ?Yes?. Ex: Yes
Indicates if the location is ready for converged billing.
Additional information regarding this address.
Unique value used to identify this address from OVALS-NSP. Ex: P2b646475f
This is the address matching level code. Ex: SE1
This is the detailed description for the address matching level code. Ex: Standardized to USPS data. LastLine changes: StateProvince, City, and ZIP4. AddressLine1 changes: StreetSuffix.
Affiliate company associated with ILEC.
Descriptive Address name. The descriptive is a reference to a specific address location. Ex: WOODLAWN LAKE APTS
Clli code for the building.
Concatenation of fields CENTRAL-OFFICE-1-2 and CENTRAL-OFFICE-3 on the ASON SAG Extract file. MW and W only. Ex: AB, 713
Central office type obtained from NECA. EX: RC
Code indentifying geographic areas of both micro and metro populations.
The exchange code for the sag range record. Ex: KWD
Exchange (combination of exchange code and central office in the W). Ex: LA AN

Geocoding components return location codes indicating the accuracy of the assigned geocode. Location codes that begins with... - "A" are address location codes. - "C" are street centroid location codes. - "Z" are ZIP + 4 centroid location codes. - "G" are geographic centroid location codes - "E" indicate that neither an address location nor a ZIP + 4 centroid could be determined. Example: AS0

Geocoding components return match codes indicating the address portions that matched or did not match to the database. If the geocoder cannot make a match, the match code begins with E and the remaining digits indicate why the address did not match. Example: S00; SA0
SE Telcordia Horizontal Coordinate for a specific location.
Independent Company Name Example: SOUTHWESTERN BELL
Independent Company service wire center clli.

Local Access and Transport Area Definition - A geographical area within which a divested Bell Operating Company (BOC) is permitted to offer exchange telecommunications and exchange access services. Returned for all regions. OVALS/MLDB will derive this from a LFACS WIRECENTER table internally. Ex: 720, 526
LATA - Local access and transport area Example: ST LOUIS MISSOURI
A code representing the Local Exchange Carrier responsible for addresses within this Geographic Segment. Ex: TM00
Short Operating Company Name Example: COVAD
Primary NPANXX Example: 817949
Operating Company Name Example: SOUTHWESTERN BELL
Operating Company Number Example: 9533
Dominant CLLI11 Example: TMBLCT00DS0
Name of the geocoding engine used to standardize this address. Ex: EGM
Indicates if match made on the street, city, or postal code level. Ex: "Street"
M = matched, A = alternate, E = unmatched
Post Office (PO). Must be a valid post office for the Sag Community(city) and zipcode. PO is used in the East (CT). Ex: BRKLYN
The remainder of the street address in SAG, after the "house number" part and the directional are removed.
rate_center for the location. Ex: MOJAVE
The rate zone of code for the rate zone in which the geographic segment is located. Ex: TX1
MW Rate zone Band. Ex: B
The regional SAG data source that OVALS/MLDB received the SAG Range data from. Ex: SW, W, E
Indicates if in region or in franchise. Y=in region in franchise, O=in region out of franchise, N=out of region out of franchise

A 3 digit number ranging from 100-999 that represents a standardization of match level across geocode engines. The higher the score the better the placement. A score of 700-799 would mean a street level match. Ex: 700
Serving WireCenter CLLI as defined for the GIS address in the GIS database.
The tax area code (TAR) or the code for the tax structure levied on customers in the geographic segment. Ex: KWD
SE Telcordia Vertical Coordinate for a specific location.
WLL - Wireless Local Loop Ex: 7882295954
use the get CAFII WLL info
Indicates if npa-nxx split is available. Ex: True
State where Rate Center is located
A geographical designation used by phone companies to determine billing charges.
Abbreviated name of the ratecenter
D2 Advantage Lite --d2liteEligibleUnconfirmed d2liteNotEligibleUnconfirmed d2liteActive d2liteEligibleConfirmed d2liteNotEligibleConfirmed d2liteEligibleRestricted d2liteNotEligibleRestricted
D2 Advantage Lite---d2liteNotRestricted,d2liteRestricted
Indicates number of structures on the property - Acceptable Values 0 - Single Structure Parcel, 1 - First or Main Parcel for Multi Structures, 2-99999 Additional Structures with Same Parcel Number

This field contains a 2 character code that indicates the structure type of the property - Acceptable Values 1 - Conventional House, 2 - Modular Mul House, 3 - Rustic Mul, 4 - Townhouse End Unit, 5 - Townhouse Middle Unit, 6 - Mobile Home, 7 - 4- Wide Mobile Home, 8 - Commercial, 9 - Miscellaneous, 10 - Cabin, blank - unknown or not provided

A Block Group number represents a cluster of blocks having the same first digit of their four-digit identifying numbers with a census tract. Generally, a block group contains between 600- 3000 people with an optimum size of 1500 people. Block Groups never cross the boundaries of census tracts.

Census Tracts are small, relatively permanent statistical subdivisions of a county that do not cross county boundaries. Generally, a Census tract contains between 1,500 - 8,000 people with an optimum size of 4,000 people. The tract numbers range from 0001-9999 and are unique within a county. Tract numbers with a range from 9400-9499 are reserved for American Indian reservations or trust lands.

The FIPS County Code represents the primary political subdivision of most states. Each county or county equivalent (e.g. an independent city that is considered a county) is assigned a 3-digit FIPS code. These codes are unique within a state.

Y = Record is DPV deliverable. Address is confirmed, delivery point and secondary delivery point have been validated. S = Record is DPV deliverable. Address confirmed, however there is an extra or incorrect secondary address. D = Record is DPV deliverable. Address Confirmed, however missing secondary address information.
Indicates the total number of stories for all structures on the property

Precision indicator for latitude and longitude values.Blank = Latitude/Longitude could not be determined 2 = The area center of the zip sector (Zip+2) centroid 4 = The area center of the zip+4 centroid 5 = The area center of the input zip code using the centroids of the zip+4's within the zips R = Rooftop centroid T = Center of population of the census tract determined Z = Area center of the input zip code using centroid of zips boundary
Indicates the number of bedrooms for all structures on the property
Persistent Record ID for the address
The jurisdictional use code

The primary jurisdictional identifier for a property. Where multiple identifiers are available from the jurisdiction, the PROPERTY_ID is the preferred and/or most easily searchable per the assessor?s office. For counties where recorder's data is available, an effort is made to have the PROPERTY_ID be the same identifier as is commonly found on the documents. This is commonly known as the Assessor Parcel Number.

Coded value for Standard Use Code - A: Single Family Dwelling; B: Condo; D: 2-4 Unit (Duplex, Triplex, Quad); E: Misc Residential (Condo Store/Flat, some Timeshares, etc.); G: Apartment 5+ units; M - Mobile Home; T ? Timeshare | R: Residential Street Address, S: Business Street Address, C: Residential High Rise, H: Business High Rise, K: MDU Indicator, P: PO Box, U: Unknown
Indicates the total number of rooms for all structures on the property
The standardized two digit numeric FIPS State identification code
FIPS: Federal Information Processing Standards
Blank = unknown 2 = Hawaii 3 = Alaska 4 = Pacific 5 = Mountain 6 = Central 7 = Eastern 8 = Atlantic
Year in which the primary structure was built on the property
As deakerId

D2 Advantage Lite
It is defaltzipplus4 for backend database
External LEC address validation.
Unique ID for validation transaction from backend.
A unique number for each address returned.
Indicates if the input address was changed during backend (ASOC) processing. Ex: Changed
Incumbent local exchange carrier; local serving office.
Indicates if npa-nxx split is available. Ex: Y
This will be populated if more then one address is returned or if the addressMatchCode returns an error. Or Will be populate if only one address is returned and the addressMatchCode is a match.
Structure containing postal address inforamtion.
Match code indicating the precision to which the address information was matched.
Indicator for validation of city, state, postal code combination. "Y" - valid, "N" - not valid, "I" - incomplete input

Indicates the type and precision of the address. 1st char is the Address Type; F - Firm, G - General delivery, H - High-rise, M - Military, P - PO box, R ? Rural/HC route, S ? Street. 2nd char is D or blank; D means that a more precise zip4 could be assigned if more info had been provided. ?UD? (Unique default) is also a possible value, meaning no zip4 assignments or address could not be matched.
Description for Address Match Code values that designate no match, an inexact match, or a match with extenuating circumstances
Match code status indicating the Business Object precision to which the address information was matched.

The Coding Accuracy Support System (CASS) Record Type. F - Firm, G - General delivery, H - High-rise, M - Military, P - PO box, R ? Rural/HC route, S ? Street. Only returned for addresses with an addressMatchCode beginning with ?3S? or ?4S?.
The Coding Accuracy Support System (CASS) Record Type. (e.g. O - No tiebreak options, 1 - Inexact postcode1 move assignemt, 2 -Input postcode2 assignment, 3 - tiebreaking used to make assignment

The Delivery Point Validation Code provides address status within DPV directory. (e.g. Y - Primary ragne and secondary ragne are valid, N - Not valid delivery point, S - Primary range is valid but seondary is not, D - Primary range is valie but seoncary not available, L - Address triggered DPB locking)
The MSAG Geographic positional coordinates for longitude and latitude
Locatable Address Conversion System (LACS) Information. Returns the match status for LACSLink processing. ?A? = address converted by LACSLink
Locatable Address Conversion System (LACS) code. (e.g. T - Address needs 911 conversion, F - Address does not need conversion)

Returns the conversion status of addresses processed by LACS Link:.. "Y" - Address converted by LACSLink, "N" - Address looked up with LACSLink but not converted, "F" - address was a false-positive, "S" - LACSLink conversion was made, but it was necessary to drop the secondary information
Returns the match status for LACSLink processing.
Structure containing postal location supplemental information.
Location attributes common to all.
Abbreviated time zone. Ex: CST
Fully spelled out time zone. Ex: Central Time (CST/CDT)
Date that DST starts for this address (YYYYMMDD).
Date that DST ends for this address (YYYYMMDD).
Coordinated universal time offset using standard time. Ex: -5
Coordinated universal time offset using daylight savings time. Ex: -4
Oracle Field Service Cloud

used to differentiate the multiple responses based on the multiple requested lookup. This field indicates that the response is based on which requested parameters like "requestedFieldedAddress","requestedUnfieldedAddress", "requestedState", "requestedZip5", "requestedLatLon", "requestedWireCenter", "requestedBuildingClli".

Distribution area and/or PON (passive optical network) serving area. One location can have one or more records. It could be located within a given copper boundary and also at the same time within a fiber boundary that is different.
Base Address GlobalLocationId
Response code and description specific to each backend system. Ex: SS0003 - Exact match. Supplementals exist.
Indicates which backend the status is associated to.
Easy to read match status based on host response code.
Page info for data return.
CSI response code and description. Ex: 100 - Request Contain Invalid Parameter
